conclusion: Ensure light from point source inside sphere passes without total internal reflection.
Critical angle is angle above which total internal reflection occurs.
Light ray from point source S travels to surface at point P; O is center, d is distance from O to S.
Angle of incidence θ_i related to sphere geometry: sin(θ_i) = d/R.
To avoid total internal reflection: sin(θ_i) ≤ sin(θ_c).
Final answer: Point source must be within distance d ≤ R/n from center.
